design_row.description: Patient portal for appointment scheduling medical records and telehealth

findings.message: WebRTC signaling server lacks authentication. Attackers can hijack telehealth video sessions and eavesdrop on doctor-patient consultations.

message.text: WebRTC signaling server lacks authentication. Attackers can hijack telehealth video sessions and eavesdrop on doctor-patient consultations.

findings.message: JWT secret key is only 8 characters long. Vulnerable to brute force attacks allowing unauthorized access to patient portal.

message.text: JWT secret key is only 8 characters long. Vulnerable to brute force attacks allowing unauthorized access to patient portal.

findings.message: Session fixation vulnerability in patient portal login. Session ID not regenerated after authentication.

message.text: Session fixation vulnerability in patient portal login. Session ID not regenerated after authentication.

raw.summary: JWT signature verification bypass in jsonwebtoken library. Allows attackers to forge valid tokens and access patient records.
WebRTC signaling vulnerability allows man-in-the-middle attacks on video streams. Attackers can intercept telehealth consultations.
Socket.io authentication bypass allows unauthorized WebSocket connections to real-time patient monitoring data.

design_row.description: HL7 FHIR integration with Epic Cerner and Allscripts EHR systems

findings.message: Protected Health Information (PHI) exposed in API response without proper authorization check. Patient medical records can be accessed by unauthorized users.

message.text: Protected Health Information (PHI) exposed in API response without proper authorization check. Patient medical records can be accessed by unauthorized users.

findings.message: XML External Entity (XXE) injection in HL7 message parser. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including patient database credentials.

message.text: XML External Entity (XXE) injection in HL7 message parser. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including patient database credentials.

findings.message: SQL injection in prescription lookup query. Attacker can access all patient prescriptions including controlled substances.

message.text: SQL injection in prescription lookup query. Attacker can access all patient prescriptions including controlled substances.

findings.message: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in lab results API. Users can view other patients' lab results by manipulating patient_id parameter.

message.text: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in lab results API. Users can view other patients' lab results by manipulating patient_id parameter.

findings.message: No audit logging for PHI access. HIPAA requires comprehensive audit trails for all PHI access and modifications.

message.text: No audit logging for PHI access. HIPAA requires comprehensive audit trails for all PHI access and modifications.

findings.message: Regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in patient name validation. Complex regex can cause service outage.

Twilio SMS for appointment reminders and test results
Encrypted backup of all PHI to AWS S3 with 7-year retention

findings.message: Path traversal vulnerability in DICOM image download. Attackers can access arbitrary files on server including patient database backups.

message.text: Path traversal vulnerability in DICOM image download. Attackers can access arbitrary files on server including patient database backups.

non_cve_findings.message: Protected Health Information (PHI) exposed in API response without proper authorization check. Patient medical records can be accessed by unauthorized users.
XML External Entity (XXE) injection in HL7 message parser. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including patient database credentials.
SQL injection in prescription lookup query. Attacker can access all patient prescriptions including controlled substances.
Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in lab results API. Users can view other patients' lab results by manipulating patient_id parameter.
WebRTC signaling server lacks authentication. Attackers can hijack telehealth video sessions and eavesdrop on doctor-patient consultations.
Hardcoded AES encryption key used for PHI encryption. Key is embedded in source code and committed to Git repository.
Path traversal vulnerability in DICOM image download. Attackers can access arbitrary files on server including patient database backups.
JWT secret key is only 8 characters long. Vulnerable to brute force attacks allowing unauthorized access to patient portal.
Patient SSN, diagnosis codes, and prescription details logged in plaintext. Violates HIPAA Privacy Rule and Security Rule.
No audit logging for PHI access. HIPAA requires comprehensive audit trails for all PHI access and modifications.

assertions.detail: CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). HL7 parser processes untrusted XML from external healthcare providers. XXE can expose entire patient database. HIPAA breach notification required if exploited. IMMEDIATE PATCHING REQUIRED.
CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). Imaging service processes untrusted DICOM files. RCE could allow attacker to access all medical imaging and PHI. Emergency patch scheduled for tonight.

CRITICAL: Active exploitation confirmed (KEV). EHR integration is core functionality. Token compromise = access to all connected EHR systems. Potential HIPAA breach affecting millions of patients. IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED.
HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Telehealth is internet-facing. MITM could expose confidential medical discussions. HIPAA Privacy Rule violation. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
HIGH PRIORITY: Functional exploit available. Patient portal is internet-facing. Token forgery = unauthorized PHI access. HIPAA Security Rule violation. Upgrade scheduled for this week.
LOW PRIORITY: Code review confirms lodash.template is not used anywhere in codebase. Only safe utility functions are used. Upgrade planned for next maintenance window.
LOW PRIORITY: Prototype pollution requires user-controlled request config. Our implementation only makes requests to pre-configured EHR endpoints. Scheduled for next maintenance window.

Path traversal vulnerability in DICOM image download. Attackers can access arbitrary files on server including patient database backups.

Run internal and external network vulnerability scans quarterly
Data Protection by Design and Default

properties.message: WebRTC signaling server lacks authentication. Attackers can hijack telehealth video sessions and eavesdrop on doctor-patient consultations.
JWT secret key is only 8 characters long. Vulnerable to brute force attacks allowing unauthorized access to patient portal.
Session fixation vulnerability in patient portal login. Session ID not regenerated after authentication.
Protected Health Information (PHI) exposed in API response without proper authorization check. Patient medical records can be accessed by unauthorized users.
XML External Entity (XXE) injection in HL7 message parser. Allows attackers to read arbitrary files from server including patient database credentials.
SQL injection in prescription lookup query. Attacker can access all patient prescriptions including controlled substances.
Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) in lab results API. Users can view other patients' lab results by manipulating patient_id parameter.
Patient SSN, diagnosis codes, and prescription details logged in plaintext. Violates HIPAA Privacy Rule and Security Rule.
No audit logging for PHI access. HIPAA requires comprehensive audit trails for all PHI access and modifications.
Regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) in patient name validation. Complex regex can cause service outage.
No rate limiting on prescription submission endpoint. Allows attackers to flood system with fake prescriptions.
Hardcoded AES encryption key used for PHI encryption. Key is embedded in source code and committed to Git repository.
PHI transmitted to pharmacy network without TLS encryption. Prescription data sent over HTTP instead of HTTPS.
Path traversal vulnerability in DICOM image download. Attackers can access arbitrary files on server including patient database backups.

recommendations: Increase concurrency or disable heavy modules for near real-time execution
